description: (adj.) – brief and to the point; effectively cut short
eg: Jessica is so talkative that her sister thought the situation warranted conciseness, and her being laconic.

description: (noun) – someone who attacks cherished beliefs or institutions
eg: Irrespective of his actuating motives, his deeds as an iconoclast will be treated harshly and is answerable in court.

description: (adj.) – difficult to accomplish, hard to endure
eg: James and Mathew are planning to leave for the states next week for their masters, following months of arduous GRE preparation.

description: (adj.) – recklessly extravagant or wasteful in the use of resources
eg: The senate is particularly perturbed over our profligate use of natural resources such as forest, oil, water, energy, land and minerals.

description: (adj.) – not challenging; dull and lacking excitement

description: (adj.) – obedient or attentive to an excessive degree

description: (adj.) – Conforming to all the traditional beliefs, and religious practices

description: (adj.) – acting or done quickly and without thought or care

description: (noun) – a way of thought peculiar to an individual
eg: Modern technologies are a lot more expensive than their existing alternatives and each has its own idiosyncrasies that be conquered.

description: (adj.) – pretentious and vulgar display intended to impress, show off

description: (verb) alter or debase, often for profit

description: (adj.) – tending to talk a great deal; talkative
